properties.Name: Employee
properties.Description: An individual who is hired to provide services to a company on a regular basis in exchange for compensation.

Columns.Name: EmployeeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Employee.

Columns.Name: EmployeeName
Columns.Description: The name of the Employee.

Columns.Name: DateOfBirth
Columns.Description: The date of birth of the employee.

Columns.Name: DateOfDeath
Columns.Description: The date of death of the employee.

Columns.Name: EmployeeStandardCostAmount
Columns.Description: The standard cost for the employee.

Columns.Name: EmployeeOvertimeCostAmount
Columns.Description: The overtime cost for the employee.

Columns.Name: EmployeeHireDate
Columns.Description: The date upon which the Employee was hired.

Columns.Name: HighlyCompensatedEmployeeIndicator
Columns.Description: Highly compensated employees are employees that receive compensation over a certain amount for a specific year.  The amount that qualifies an employee as a 'highly compensated' employee varies from year to year.

Columns.Name: KeyEmployeeIndicator
Columns.Description: An employee who, at any time during the plan year is (1) an officer having annual compensation greater than $130,000 (subject to cost-of-living adjusting), (2) a more-than-5-percent owner of the employer, or (3) a more-than-1-percent owner whose annual compensation exceeds $150,000.

Columns.Name: ExemptEmployeeIndicator
Columns.Description: An exempt employee is an employee who, because of his or her positional duties and responsibilities and level of decision making authority is exempt from the overtime provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA). Exempt employees are expected, by most organizations, to work whatever hours are necessary to accomplish the goals and deliverables of the position. Thus, exempt employees have more flexibility in their schedules to come and go as necessary to accomplish work than non-exempt or hourly employees.

Columns.Name: NonexemptEmployeeIndicator
Columns.Description: When an employee is classified as nonexempt, it means that the employee is entitled to a minimum wage, and overtime pay at the rate of time and one-half the regular rate for all hours worked in excess of 40 hours per week, as well as other protections under child labor and equal pay as prescribed by the FLSA.

Columns.Name: AlienStatusId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Alien Status.

Columns.Name: SexId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Sex.

Columns.Name: GenderId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Gender.

Columns.Name: RacialCategoryId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Racial Category.

Columns.Name: EthnicCategoryId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Ethnic Category.

Columns.Name: EmploymentLeadSourceId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Employment Lead Source.

Columns.Name: SecurityClearanceId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Security Clearance.

Columns.Name: SecurityLevelId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Security Level.

Columns.Name: PartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Properties.Description: An individual who is hired to provide services to a company on a regular basis in exchange for compensation.
